product_overview: edlingo-electron is an Electron-based desktop application that provides AI-powered personalized language learning exercises, user authentication via Supabase, and comprehensive progress tracking, all wrapped in a modern React UI with responsive components.
core_goals: Enable seamless user authentication including signup and login with session management.
Deliver personalized language learning exercises powered by AI to aid user learning.
Track and display user progress with meaningful statistics to motivate continued learning.
Ensure reliable integration with backend services like Supabase for authentication and data storage.
Provide a smooth and responsive UI experience with reusable components and animations.
Manage Electron app lifecycle and routing effectively for cross-platform desktop usage.
key_features: User Authentication using Supabase for secure signup, login, and session management.
AI-Powered Language Learning exercises generated dynamically for personalized user experience.
Progress Tracking that stores, retrieves, and visualizes learning progress data.
Electron Main Process managing app lifecycle and window creation for desktop.
Database Initialization for local persistent storage of app data.
Reusable UI Components styled with Tailwind CSS and animated via Framer Motion.
Application Routing handled by React Router for smooth navigation between app views.
user_flow_summary: User launches the Electron app, greeted with a login or signup screen powered by Supabase authentication.
Upon successful login, user accesses the personalized dashboard showing learning progress and options to start or continue exercises.
User initiates AI-generated language exercises tailored to their progress and preferences.
User completes exercises; progress data is saved and reflected in the dashboard statistics.
User can log out or exit the application gracefully through the Electron interface.
validation_criteria: Authentication must allow new user signup and valid credential login as verified by Supabase service.
AI exercise generation should produce dynamic, personalized content based on user data.
Progress tracking must accurately save and retrieve user progress without data loss.
UI components must render responsively across devices and support smooth animations.
Electron app lifecycle events must be handled correctly including window management.
Application should gracefully handle AI service failures and fallback scenarios without crashes.
Routing must correctly present views corresponding to the user authentication state and actions.
